page.title: 11FARMING AROUND SKELMERSDALE
page.content:
Farming has always played a very important part in the lives of people in our area. Much of the land is used for agriculture and the town of Skelmersdale is built on land previously used for farming.
Many farmers are tenants who pay a rent to the landowner. One such farmer is Mr. Tom Hurst who works land belonging to Lord Derby's estate.
The following is an edited version of an interview with Mr. Hurst:
COULD YOU TELL US THE NAME OF YOUR FARM? Yes, it is called Bullen's Farm. DO YOU OWN THE FARM? No,my brother and I are tenants. The land is part of Lord Derby's estate. HOW LONG HAS YOUR FAMILY WORKED HERE? Since 1693 at least,maybe longer.
